meanings.definition: To cause something to sink below the surface of water.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally sunks his toy boat in the bathtub.
meanings.sent2: The rock sunks quickly in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous duck sunks the rubber ducky for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her heavy heart sunks deeper with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The anchor sunks to the ocean floor, never to be seen again.

meanings.definition: To descend or drop to a lower level.
meanings.sent1: The sunks elevator brought them to the basement.
meanings.sent2: The sunks sun disappeared behind the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel sunks down the tree trunk after finding a nut.
meanings.sent4: The balloon sunks slowly as the air leaked out.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker's energy sunks as she reached the summit.

meanings.definition: To experience a decrease in value or quality.
meanings.sent1: The old car sunks in resale price over the years.
meanings.sent2: The quality of the product sunks after the company changed owners.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm sunks when he realized he forgot his homework.
meanings.sent4: The mood of the room sunks as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: Her confidence sunks as she receives more criticism.
